column1: Customer found a piece of foil in his meal choice. During the light bite service, Mr. Mcginn brought to my attention that he have found  a piece of foil cover a diameter of 1x1cm, in the Lamb Pie, found in between the minced meat. Asked crew member Lisa if she checked prior to delivered the meal, Cabin Crew Lisa stated that she checked and there was nothing on the Pie and Galley operator Ali stated that he made sure that there was no foreign object on the pie. Customer stated that he found the piece of foil inside the pie in between the minced meat. As I went to YC to grab the Foreign object form, the Lamb pie that was left in the galley to be stowed in the product and audit container was gone and being discharged by the galley operator Ali, despite informing everyone in the JC galley that there was a piece of foil inside and I need to report it, hence there will be no foreign object report in the product audit container.

Short of Tray Due to Neglectful Management of Caterer Pax load was 296 ( Full 7 carts and 1 half cart for lunch)  Service was Lunch and Light Bite. Caterer went to check with MID galley in Y class. Tereza checked with caterer that 2 carts for lunch and 1 cart for light bite are loaded. Tereza (Mid galley operator) claimed that she is short of 1 lunch cart. Caterer replied 1 cart will be in AFT galley. Caterer went check loading in AFT galley. Elena checked with caterer that there are 5 carts for lunch and 2 carts for light bite which makes it 7 carts for lunch and short of half cart. Elena was told 3 carts in MID galley by caterer  which was not true.  Before leaving the aircraft, Caterer was asked for missing lunch cart by Tereza and caterer replied it is in the AFT galley. It was only discovered that 25 Customers in AFT area were out of trays during the lunch service.

VERY UNHAPPY ABOUT THE FISH HOT MEAL,The customer chose ROASTED SEABASS FILLET from the menu.As soon as the meal was served, the customer complained the fish smelled bad.He seemed angry and complained that, since recently, the "fish dishes served on EK smell very bad."When the crew requested him to describe smell he was referring to in the dish served, he appeared upset that the crew had requested to be specific. He returned his meal and opted for the chicken choice.He was travelling with his two children and he made the children return their meals as well, and opted for Beef.Customer claimed that he had complained about the fish not smelling fresh before as well.Customer claimed the chicken was "FINE".Upon investigation, crew did not find the fish smelling unusual.Received no complaints from other customers who had fish.Received no further complaints from Mr Beheshti.

RETURN TO STAND DUE TO GALLEY POWER OFF IN AFT GALLEY OF YC, DRY ICE LOADED Before take off it was reported to the engineer that the galley power in aft of YC was inoperative. Before closing the last door, engineer liaised with the Captain that galley power should switch on when the aircraft's engines start. During taxi, Captain liaised with Cabin Supervisor Atikilt (409292) if galley power was on (oven, brewer, air chiller, trash compactor) however it remained without power. With the aft galley power off, oven won't work and we won't be able to heat meals for both sectors in the aft galley of YC. Due to air chiller being inoperative, we can not ensure freshness of return sector meals and keep it chilled for the duration of the flight and time on ground in Amman. Captain was advised that no meals can be requested or ordered from outstation with such short notice.

Customer details 82D MMr Malini SridharShortage of AVML meals  On EK 207 we were catered for 14 AVML , however after receiving the PIL  (flight manifest) it showed 60 AVML which the customers had actually pre ordered.  Due to flight cancellation of 207 our KIS tablets had no information about customer details nor catering information to refer to .I only had the menu as a reference and the catering supervisor . The catering staff also did not have much information about this flight due to last minute changes. We received the PIL just before the last door was closed which was to late to order any meals . What I did realise was that only the waitlisted meals were catered which were 7 CHML instead of 1514AVML instead of 60 and I was missing a Gluten free meal.Over all we were catered for a full flight but with insufficient special meals.

Due to flight cancellation of 207 our KIS tablets had no information about customer details nor catering information to refer to .I only had the menu as a reference and the catering supervisor . The catering staff also did not have much information about this flight due to last minute changes. We received the PIL just before the last door was closed which was to late to order any meals . What I did realise was that only the waitlisted meals were catered which were 7 CHML instead of 1514AVML instead of 60 and I was missing a Gluten free meal.Over all we were catered for a full flight but with insufficient special meals.

Meal Feedback Miss Zena explained that the VLML and VGML in all emirates flights is very plain and bland. Today the appetizer was mozzarella and tomatoes. The main course was pasta with capsicum peppers, macaroni and cheese on tomato sauce. She stated that the food is OK, but it is not something special as Business class food should be. The pasta quality is similar to canned pasta. There was a two big pieces of asparagus. The part close to the end was tender and nice to eat. But the other end piece was very hard and chewy. She stated that she looks forward to the flight for the service, drinks and seat comfort, but the vegetarian food on all flights is just plain. Miss Zena explained that for the ticket price that she pays, there should be a selection of vegetarian meals which she can choose from.email: zena.marie85@yahoo.com

QUALITY OF FOOD ONBOARD MIGHT BE COMPROMISED DUE TO COLLECTIVE GALLEY CHILLER FAILURE ON THE INBOUND FLIGHT.This Flight has double catering due to catering disruption in the CPH station.The catering for return sector was loaded from DXB in all respective galleys.After take off on the DXBCPH sector the inbound crew reported major defect with a collective failure of all the galley chillers on the A/C .Despite several resets they were unable to fix it .Further the Engineers on ground CPH could not fix it either.Dry ice was brought to combat the situation to some extent , but this reached the A/C after we started boarding in CPH .Effectively the meals and the other food items (perishables ) were not chilled for several hours which includes most of the flying time inbound and a major part of the ground time in CPH.

QUALITY OF FOOD ONBOARD MIGHT BE COMPROMISED DUE TO COLLECTIVE GALLEY CHILLER FAILURE ON THE INBOUND FLIGHT.This Flight has double catering due to catering disruption in the CPH station.The catering for return sector was loaded from DXB in all respective galleys.After take off on the DXBCPH sector the inbound crew reported major defect with a collective failure of all the galley chillers on the A/C .Despite several resets they were unable to fix it .Further the Engineers on ground CPH could not fix it either.Dry ice was brought to combat the situation to some extent , but this reached the A/C after we started boarding in CPH .Effectively the meals and the other food items (perishables ) were not chilled for several hours which includes most of the flying time inbound and a major part of the ground time in CPH.

Feedback on KHI sectorsBlock time of 01:39 and 01:59hs, for each sector today.Each sector was fully booked in JC, which means a total of 8 meal carts per sector, total of 16 return.As per EK standards, each cart should have 1 orange juice and 1 apple juice. That means a total of 16 orange and 16 apple juices  32 total.In total, we were catered in YC 8 orange, 8 apple, 8 pineapple, 8 mango, 8 tomato juices  40 juices  out of 4 containers in YC. No juices in the fridges.For a sector with less than 2hr duration, there were over 40 SPML on DXB KHI, which takes away precious time from the main service.On the KHI DXB sector, the main course was Spanish Paella. That means, Emirates Airlines served paella on a pakistani flight. Customer did not know what is paella and the crew tried to explain it as "spanish biryani".

Customer details78A Mrs Anu Sampat Shortage of AVML meals Customer did not get her AVML as it was not loaded. On EK 207 we were catered for 14 AVML , however after receiving the PIL  (flight manifest) it showed 60 AVML which the customers had actually pre ordered.  Due to flight cancellation of 207 our KIS tablets had no information about customer details nor catering information to refer to .I only had the menu as a reference and the catering supervisor  . The catering staff also had no much information about this flight due to last minute changes. I only received the PIL just before the last door was closed which was to late to order any meals . what I did realise was that only the waitlisted meals were catered which were 7 CHML instead of 1514AVML instead of 60 and I was missing a Gluten free meal.

CUSTOMER NOT SATISFIED WITH HER MEALDuring the service customer came to the aft Galey with her meal tray saying that the food was too spicy.She sad she was furious and we should  put a warning if we serve meals that are so spicy.Customer insisted that I taste the food and tell her it was not spicy.Customer Claimed the hot meal(chicken) and the starter(salmon) were both spicy.Customer demanded to have some yoghurt and cheese from J class.Few hours later Miss Jane started yelling at customers around her asking them to quiet down and put their alarms off. She called the attention of the crew to look for the customer who had their alarm on.I stood beside Miss Jane and she kept telling me " cant you hear the alarm its soo loud"I could not hear any alarm neither could the customers sitting around her.

Customer was unhappy with the quality of Seafood meal. During the meal service, cabin crew Tanisha Tyagi, staff number 423701, claimed that Mr Heck was not happy with the quality and content of his Seafood meal.  Tanisha claimed that Mr Heck stated she had given him the wrong meal. When speaking to Mr Heck, he stated that he has noticed a drop on overall meal quality on catering out of Dubai.  Mr Heck stated that seafood meal used to offer a selection of prawns with two or three other grilled seafood in the casserole. Seafood meal contained egg fried rice with fried prawns and mushrooms. Mr Heck claimed that "the portion of prawns was too small, the rice was not nice and the mushrooms were too soft. "Mr Heck contact details: Phone: +49698072402Mobile: +491736246628Email: alexander@siemens.com

The meals loaded on the aircraft for cabin crew are not enough for everyone.There was 7 hot meals loaded in the whole aircraft (4 pasta and 3 chicken)5 salad boxes with spring beans and white beans inside (1/3 of the box filled) and this supposed to be an alternative healthy meal.5 lettuce plastic traysIn addition to the standard yogurt, and apples, banana and veg / tuna sandwiches (1 tray per galley)The above meals are supposed to be enough for 15 cabin crew for dinner (DXBBLR) and breakfast (BLRDXB)These meals were not even enough for the first sector (Dinner) and they lack variety.Note this turn around is a 9 hours out of base in addition to signing in 2 hours before the flight and 1 hour after the flight. We are away from our accommodation for around 13 hours, awake the whole night.

Discrepancy in the food loading.Total PAX in F/class is 5 (five).The top up catering arrived just in time before closing the door despite this flight being a scheduled delayed departure. Extra caviar was brought but no extra condiments for it. Hence for two main meal services we had only one tray of caviar condiments. salad was still for 03 pax. chocolate dessert was of three different kinds. hot canapes' for the top up catering was missing.  second set of flight deck meals and trays were missing. couldn't find them in business or economy.Whatever top up catering arrived was not as per the guidelines for a 05 Pax in a 08pax first class cabin configuration with two main meal services.Mr. Shibin, the aircraft catering officer had no control over the top up stuff sent from Flight catering.

Shortage of meal trays in economy Load is 156. Catering supervisor refused to complete checks with the crew, since he claimed he had already checked everything; he had to be prompted and catering was checked by CSVs. During catering checks it was established , as per providers information, that the amount catered is 155 trays. As per catering checks guidelines, we checked one try in each cart for contents and quality, and established the amount of trays, checking all special meals. During the service, we did not have enough trays. I checked all carts in both galleys and there were not enough trays for the customers. 6 customers did not have a tray and that was with 4 customers who did not eat. The amount of hot meals was sufficient for the load.

Quality of main course:Customer informed me, while I cleared his tray, that his main course (the chicken picata) was disgusting.I asked the customer if there something more specific regarding the meal that I could write about as feedback.Customer said the chicken was 'raw' and the vegetables were cold.He added that it was the same on his flight from Germany.He also mentioned that emirates standards have dropped and that the entire meal is 'cheap' and that the service has gone down.Customer was quite upset regarding this matter and said that this is the last time he will travel with Emirates.He also mentioned his flight from 2yrs ago where his bag was damaged flying with Emirates, and he said all he got was an email to wrap his bag in the future.

VJML ORDERED BUT WASN'T AVAILABLE During catering checks, the catering staff from GLA pointed out that it has been ordered 1 VJML instead of 2 VJML.  When presenting the meal checklist, the number of VJML was 2 but the catering staff in GLA modified to 1 as there was no second meal available. After the flight details were complete on the KIS tablet and the PIL presented at the end of boarding, I printed the stickers and observed that there are 2 VJML. Ms Morrison was traveling with 48E  Mr. Thompson that was having also a VJML ordered. Ms. Morrison specified that she is having a connecting flight and if it's possible to have her meal available on the next sector. the Customer in 48E  Mr. Thompson had the VJML, and Ms. Morrison had the chicken.

Customer details 82DAkshay SridharShortage of AVML meals  On EK 207 we were catered for 14 AVML , however after receiving the PIL  (flight manifest) it showed 60 AVML which the customers had actually pre ordered.  Due to flight cancellation of 207 our KIS tablets had no information about customer details nor catering information to refer to .I only had the menu as a reference and the catering supervisor  which he also did not have much information about this flight due to last minute changes. We received the PIL just before the last door was closed which was to late to order any meals . what I did realise was that only the waitlisted meals were catered which were 7 CHML instead of 1514AVML instead of 60 and I was missing a Gluten free meal.

RE : VLML.. During Lunch Service, Ms. Wilson mentioned that she had preordered a VLML through her travel agent prior of her traveling.. Ms. Wilson was very upset and abruptly raised her voice when she was informed that there was no VLML catered under her names as per the PIL and on the KIS tablet.. After the service, she was checking her travel itineracies, and she realised that didn't  preordered the VLML on DXBSYD sector.. Ms. Wilson chose the spinach ricotta pastry roll and she was informed that she had to wait for at least 20 minutes for the meal to be heat up (The meal is from the light bite service), and she agreed.. Ms. Wilson apologised to the crew member.. Ms. Wilson would preferred the VLML on her profile for her future flight.

Unhappy with Braised Beef Brisket and Panfried dorade and Rasberry CheesecakeMs Pinkerton returned the beef choice and fish choice for the alternative.Customer stated beef is very hard and sticky when chewed. Her family seated on 1F Mr Robert Fouston, Mr Frederick Fouston also returned beef choice but both Mr Fouston's choose chicken choice which was ok.Ms Pinkerton had fish (PanFried dorado)  as alternative, she also returned the fish stated the fish was not good.Ms Pinkerton declined the third offered however she took cheese selections and raspberry cheesecake.Ms Pnkerton had one bite of cheesecake and stated it was not good also.Customer then declined the hot dessert Banana Pithivier but took chocolate and coconut ice cream instead.

Incorrect Hot meals for lunch and dinner services  We were serving lunch followed by light bites followed by dinner. For lunch service, we were meant to serve ;        Coconut braised beef short ribs.        Pan fried cod.        Roasted chicken fillet.        Chicken schnitzel and Swiss cheese sandwich. For dinner service, we were meant to serve ;         Chicken with brown rice and nuts.        Shrimps with rice and vegetables.        Lamb with mashed potatoes and vegetables . The first service was lunch. The ovens were loaded with the hot meals of the dinner service. The catering staff told us to use the dinner hot meals for the lunch service. No customers complain at all. ( We did not have menus loaded on this flight anyways ).

Food quality and loading Mrs Fabbro highlighted that the main course she had ( Pasta  Penne Pomodoro) was not tasty and lacked any kind of flavour. She also mentioned that this was a very small portion and needed to be bigger. Mrs Fabbro ordered the Omelette for breakfast, however this was not available due to only 2 being loaded and other customers had breakfast as their first meal. She asked for the catering to load more as the cabin only had 6 customers. She claimed that the amount of money paid she should have a choice of meals and not be told that it was not available Mrs Fabbro claimed that the food quality is not that of a first class product and that Qantas may not do everything right, however they do get the food right

Please note that on this sector we offered our customers the following services in y/c : "Light Bites" including a "Cheese roll" sandwich and "Chocolate cake", and many customers were asking for "Beef" or "Chicken" sandwiches stating that the portion was not enough (small sandwich size). About 15 customers asked for additional sandwiches as they were hungry and mentioned that "Cheese is not food for Africans". "Hot Breakfast" including "Scrambled Eggs with spinach and chicken croquettes" and "Mushroom Omelette with chicken sausages and spinach", and again customers asked for "Rice" and commented that the meal size was not enough asking for more than one casserole each (about 10 customers asked for additional food).

During lunch service Mrs. Shnurova who was traveling with her husband ordered Panfried Pacific cod for lunch.Mrs. Shnurova was advised by crew Ana Santos s420225 that we did run out of his preferred choice of meal.Mrs. Shnurova requested for another option which was beef, unfortunately we couldn't accommodate her preference.However, the couple received one of their preferred meal choice.Customer was very upset claiming that its a J/c cabin and they have paid enough money for their preferred meal to be on board.Total meals loaded were 7 beef, 7 pan fried pacific cod, and spicy prawns noodles for 21 customers.Due to customers profile which was Europeans, the local main course (Mee Goreng) was not popular ordered.

wrong menu choice  Ms. Sinclair ordered the AVML as a special meal, but she told us she would like to try the vegetarian light bite meal From the menu. We had a vegetarian choice for the light bite as follow : VEGETABLE BURIRITO, Tortilla filled with refried beans, guacamole, sour cream, tomato salad and Mexican rice. We checked the availability, and we offered the vegetarian choice to her, but she told us that there were meat inside. We apologized to her, and we offered her original AVML, but she did not like it, then we offered some vegetarian sandwiches to her.  I personal checked the vegetarian choice, and there was red meat inside. She did not want to have her Breakfast before landing.

CAKEAfter receiving PIL and noticed customer had following under his name (on his profile): SPMLEMD 1768209664919 USD30 CONGRATULATIONS TO THE NEWLY WED COUPLE FROM SPEEDWING FAMILY. Asked JC galley operator if she had received anything for the customer. She told me catering had mentioned nothing during checks and she had been unable to locate anything special in the galley. Sent query to ground via VCC. My assumption was that it was paid for champagne but I wanted clarification. Ground replied it was for a cake but it had not been loaded, but gave me the go ahead to offer champagne instead. However when we attempted this customer told us both himself and his wife did not drink alcohol.

Catering figures for tonight's flight were poor.I have tried to address the issue with catering supervisor, but I shortly figured that he is not right person to address it with (since he is just making sure that figures on the paper given to him, are matching the physical catering load).We had 6 customers tonight.Menu was featuring Breakfast and the Dinner.Dinner meal load was as follows:Appetizers:  In addition to Caviar, Mushroom soup, and the Salad, there were,  2 mezze plates  2 grilled chicken  4 herb tuna loinMain courses:  2 steaks  2 prawns  1 chicken biryani  1 ravioli  1 poached codTotal of 7 meals were loaded.Breakfast meal load was:  2 omelettes  1 cold plateThat was it.

Customer claimed there was a hair inside of his yoghurt.The hair was found in what a customer claimed was a sealed yoghurt pot.The hair was found on the surface of the yoghurt and was not fully covered by yoghurt.The hair matched the colour of the customers hair. It was noted by crew that the yoghurts are filled by a machine with little or no human interaction. And given the various states of travel the yoghurt had encountered. It was not likely that the hair was already inside of the yoghurt and on the surface. It was noted the hair was not submerged. However. Obviously the customer claimed it was there when he opened the yoghurt. And the yoghurt was replaced with an apology.

FOOD QUALITY AND QUANTITY . Majority of the customers  preferred the LAMB PIE from the menu . The loading was as follow : Lamb pie 11,  CHX dish 8, Salad 7 and Pasta 11. Pasta was the least popular meal option as most of the customers opted for Lamb Pie which was considered substantial compared to others. Customers complained about the quality taste of Nicoise salad and Pasta ( risotto) . ( No detailed feed back given however the meal was returned ) According to Business Class crew member who often do this flight, the meal option and quantity has always been a challenge on this sector and nothing much has been done to improve the ratio and change of light bite options .

Shortage of prawn curry the nonveg option.Catered percentage is 60%.The non vegetarian option prawn curry was the most popular choice. From Row 44 onwards on LHS and RHS around 40C customers did not receive their meal choice. Certain customers who settled for vegetarian were unhappy about the quality of the option. Customers demanded for prawn curry and the alternative crew meal choices given wasn't accepted.J class meals were not offered due to the large number of passengers requesting for the prawn curry in order to avoid further complaints. Many customers claimed that south India they are not vegetarians. Suggest to increase the non veg  percentage to 70%

MS SIPPY COULD NOT EAT HER BREAKFAST AS IT WAS A MEAL WITH RICEMs Sippy stated that she could not have her breakfast as it was 'the same as the dinner'She said that tray items were breakfast but the meal had rice and looked like dinner so she could not eat it, her husband, in 54G was very frustrated and raised his voice, telling me his wife would not be eating for 12 hours and would hungry, he said he needs a reimbursement.Ms Sippy was upset because during the service she had asked the crew for some extra cheese and crackers, the crew said they would have to come back to her because they weren't sure if they would have enough, as they were only on the trays.

Pls kindly note that Achari Chicken (as written on the casserole foil) was loaded for the flight instead of Roasted Lemon Chicken with chimichurri and barley risotto with tomato and olives.2.The Achari Chicken was curry style and featured Basmati Rice instead of risotto.3.We were catered a total of 12 Achari Chicken casseroles and the rest of the catering was Nargisi Kofta (mutton) and Braised Lamb shanks.4.The Achari chicken was by far the most popular choice and the majority of the customers enjoyed it.5.There were 02 J/C premium cabin customers who preferred to have Roast Lemon Chicken (3A&3B).Those customers were offered alternative meals.

CHML Request Miss Alamri told cabin supervisor Noreen 'my child is hungry , she wants her child meal'.Cabin supervisor Noreen told Miss Alamri' certainly , I will just check if you ordered for the meal and I will deliver it to you as soon as possible'.After checking the PIL, cabin supervisor showed Miss Alamri that there was no CHML request indicated.Miss Alamri told Noreen that her husband ordered the special meal.Cabin supervisor Nureen said that 'Maybe your husband forgot to order or maybe it could have been a mistake with the system, however I will offer you the meal we have in the menu'.Miss Alamri choose the chicken for her child.

Mr Khan claimed that there was a dirty bowl on his meal tray  During the meal service Mr. Khan claimed that there was a dirty melamine bowl on his tray and also there was a bread with the polyethylene cover on top of the dirty bowl. Customer further stated that he took a picture of this dirty bowl. As my observations, Economy class dinner meal trays consist of a salad bowl, a desert bowl and bread separately on the tray and there was no space for a separate dirty empty bowl on the meal tray and the dirty bowl appeared to look like salad was just consumed as the leftover was still fresh. No further comments received from the customer.

TEMPERATURE PROBE STICKS NOT TURNING RED It was noted that on both sectors, meals were taking too long to be heated up. After 35 minutes of heating them, some temperature probe sticks were not completely red, while touching by hand, the meals were very hot. It is presumed that either the meals were loaded frozen; or the temperature probe sticks are too old and/or not work properly. All meals in all ovens were facing the same situation. No oven defects were noted. Ovens were closed and locked while heating up the meals. Service was delayed by 10 to 15 minutes in both sectors. No customers were affected or complained about the delay.

Feedback on catering supervisor. We were short of two trays for the sector as we had 13 trays and 15 trays. When the galley operator was doing her checks she found the trays inside the cart had collapsed on top of each other and hence started changing the trays to another empty cart. The catering supervisor found her doing so and when she showed her the trays the supervisor immediately went into defensive mode. She claimed that we were blaming her for something that was not her fault and that we should not be asking her. She continued to tell us that she had 14 years of experience and that she knew her job among other statements.

TRAY IS TOO FULL, MAKES LOADING DIFFICULT Trays are too full, the bread is big and is loaded where the hot meal has to be placed. Before loading, it takes time to push the bread, or the liner gets displaced while doing this as fast as possible. In a full flight takes up to 20 minutes to re arrange all trays, delaying service. Customers get affected by having the tray unarranged. No complaints were received from customers, but crew struggle always when trays are like this. Eg. From Australia, catering places a small bread on the right side of the tray, making loading very easy and trays are delivered to customers well arranged.

Suggesting to change the meal percentage  On today's flight we were offering, Grilled chicken with mashed potatoes And Beef with Noodles for dinner. The meal percentage was 50% for each main course option, however, the Beef option was more popular on today's flight. Suggesting, changing the percentage to 60% Loading for the Beef and 40% for the Chicken. As well, Chicken was not popular as it's served with mashed potatoes, customers would prefer to have it served with steamed white rice instead. Please consider the change.   6 Customers wanted to enjoy the Beef for main course. however, it was declined due to unavailability.

Customer, Ms. Hume stated that she requested for Asian vegetarian meal on her 10 previous flights and she did not get her special meal at all.During lunch service, the customer stated that she requested for Asian vegetarian meal online when she booked a ticket.There was no information on the PIL and Asian vegetarian meal was not loaded for the customer.The customer stated that she flew with emirates 10 times, requested for Asian vegetarian meal on every flight and she had never received her special meal.Contact detailsThe customer stated that she would claim to the company by herself and did not provide her contact details.

Meal choice unavailable and wrong meal ration information by catering. Both services, BF and LN, meal loading ration provided by catering was not correct. Meal ration Info provided by catering as : BF= Scrambled eggs 40% / Mushroom omelette 60%                                                                      LN = Grilled chicken 60% / Lamb 40% Actual meal ration : BF= Scrambled eggs 20% / Mushroom omelette 80%                                   LN = Grilled chicken 80% / Lamb 20% Due to this unbalance meal loading, around 50 customers did not get their first choice for both service each( Lamb and Scrambled eggs).

Cake not provided.On the PIL it is showing ,SPMl cake,In Dxd , on ground the catering Supervisor, Called in front of the J class Supervisor, the catering office to check for the cake.The answer was: "Special meal, cake not provided as waiting list.."On the KiS tablet, it shows under the Customer 'S profile :WL .Customer informed.J class Supervisor, apologized to Mr Mohamed .J Class Supervisor, showed the KIS tablet ,to Mr Mohamed and explained.Alternative of desserts offered from lounge or from the menu offered to Mr Mohamed.Mr Mohamed , declined .Mr Mohamed , understood, thankful, satisfied by crew efforts.

Customer informed crew that he was expecting HNML to be different from the meal from the menu. Customer brought to my attention that he ordered HNML and it was the same chicken hot meal that was on the menu. Customer stated that he expected HNML to be different from the menu options. Customer expected HNML to be "more spicy and different". Customer requested to have second hot meal Chicken. When customer wanted to grab attention of the crew, he was tapping them on the upper arm. Customer brought to crew attention that there is no expiry date on the dessert " carrot kheer" and stated " it's scary to eat it".

For the flights DXBKBLDXB, which departs at 11:15 and arrives at 19:00 crew meals were loaded in low quantity for the whole aircraft.In First class cabin (3 people) : 1 hot meal ( pumpkin pasta) , one green salad and 1 box salad, 2 wraps, 3 hot snacks.For Business class crew members (4 people) : 2 hot meals, 1 green salad For Economy class crew members (8 people) : 4 hot meals ( pumpkin pastas, chicken) one green salad, one box salad, 3 chicken hot snacks. The flight included lunch and dinner service for the customers. Please increase load of food for crew members / salad is most popular choice for crew.

Menu ChoicesMr Ahmed made some observations about the first class menu.His initial reaction was that it was like 'prison food'He then went on to state that our menu is like a 3 piece dinner suit and old fashioned and stuffy.He says in this day and age we should be having great choices like massive ranges of salads. i.e. Kale, Quinoa, Choices of beans not the bitter salad that he always gets.We should have options like Ben & Jerrys Ice Cream, he mentioned proper comfort food  would be a good option not the same old boring stuffy menu.He mentioned that we need to get on top of things like our competitors.

VGML NOT PROVIDED EVERY TIME CUSTOMER FLIES WITH EMIRATES  Mr. Baker informed me that on his last three flights with EK, the VGML that he requested was not provided, and was waitlisted every time.   Mr. Baker is a Skywards frequent flyer and on his profile, it clearly shows that he should have a VGML provided on his flights with Emirates. Informed me that on his previous flight, CSV also wrote a KIS report, however, there was not reply.  He would like someone to contact him regarding this issue.  His email address is: leebb@btinternet.com. Please ensure that a VGML will be provided on future flights.

BAD CHOICE OF CREW MEALS In the Crew Cart, we were loaded with two hot meals for Breakfast: Fried Eggs and Congee, then a selection of five sandwiches, some apples and bananas. All crew members in my JC team commented that none of the options looked appetizing and the hot meals were not substantial. The Crew Snacks container was loaded with unhealthy snacks. All food items remained untouched and crew were forced to wait till service's end to eat spare passenger meals. Please consider updating the variety and nutritional value of crew meals, and introduce more substantial hot meals in the crew cart.

Customers feedback about Dinner main course Few J/C customers were not happy with Dinner main course Negative feedback about the food quality and presentation Customer in 12B, Ms Awal had fish and returned it back as it is stating she didn't like it Customer in 15D, Mr Choudry changed his main course twice, none of them was good, he initially had fish and found it very salty, then vegetarian that he found it no tasty and the paratha   bread was very dry. Crew meals quantity Crew were not happy about the crew meals content regarding the quantity.Only one hot meals were provided for each cabin, 2 small Salads only provided for 6 crew in economy.Crew were not satisfied to eat from the customers meals as it was only one choice chicken.2 of the crew in economy were vegetarian, we kept the salad for them.Crew stated it is a CAT 2 for the customers as short flight but it is a whole day for them as crew, specially the crew cart contains were not enough for 6 crew for lunch & dinner regarding the check in time till arriving to Dubai at 11pm.

ISSUE FACED HEATING LAMB PIE'S (FROM LIGHT BITE SERVICE) TO CORRECT TEMPERATURE A customer complaint was received regarding the temperature of his Lamb Pie (temp probe did show pink in colour. A separate Pie was heated alone in a 'used/cold oven' for 35 minutes (pie still did not reach correct serving temperature).

On the flight I had a serious food poisoning. Meals and food loaded was for a different Menu and different services  Due to disruption to all flight operating to and from JFK, we operated EK207 that was diverted to IAD, Catering for JFK  MXP was completed by IAD catering station. Service for JFK  MXP sector in all cabins as per SSQ and Menu: Dinner followed by Breakfast. Catering loaded in JC for all cabins was for a ULR flight and was: Dinner  Light Bites  Breakfast. Food Items loaded for the similar services were different than what is mentioned in the menus. No customers complaints received.

Choice unavailable Mrs. Tong requested for the cod yakisoba main course but it was unavailable at the moment of delivery in that respective cart Cabin crew Laura (456084) informed the customer that she will try her best to find her preferred choice Laura informed me that both Mrs. Tong and her companion did not received the preferred choice, stating "The other lady should have served us, that's why we don't get anything", pointing to the cabin crew who started her cart one row after them  No other complaints were received throughout the flight

Caviar Container : No Caviar Control Form First class crew member Nader ( 402876 ) once he opened the caviar container noticed that the caviar control form had been completed for all 4 sectors, but this was for another flight. Incorrect FoodCatering had brought 2 extra trays with 2 extra meals. The Galley operator checked the meals to make sure they were consistent with the menu choices. Not enough crew meals for the length of the flight  Please, i would like to raise attention to this matter as it has been observed in all flights Not enough hot meals casseroles for the crew members for the length of the flight  Many Reports have been raised to catering but no improvement receiveFor 18h duty, as example only 8 hot casserole for lunch were loaded for 26 crew (from this, 6 were the vegetarian pasta with nil protein on this flight  In case of a diversion or extended duty time, this could be an issue on safety perspective

GALLEY CHILLERS FAILUREAfter take off, approximately one hour into the flight, it was observed that all the galley cart chillers were inop and alert message on the cabin systems advised of a fault/failure.All galleys/systems had been checked prior to departure and it was confirmed that carts chillers were functional. Seniors even physically checked galleys that cool air was coming from the cart chillers.We are return sector catered for this trip.Due to this fault, coolness integrity of return catered meals could not be assured.

Please be advised that the cockpit crew hot meals loaded for this flight were breakfast selection. Due to late flight departure , the breakfast service was cancelled and the catering brought to us Dinner meal trays instead .We conducted the lunch service after take off in all cabin and changed the sequence in Y/C to light bites as the second service and then dinner service before landing for all cabins . content of BLML tray doesn't match its name Mr Zanin have ordered BLML. He almost did not touch it. Content of the tray did not look like BLML. repetitive limited optionsCrew meals available in Y/C were 2 Chicken, 1 Salmon, 5 Ravioli pumpkin.Only 3 non vegetarians options for 10 crew in Y/C , plus 4 chicken meals left from the service, which were already cold.None of the crew ate the Ravioli as it is very repetitive in most of the flights and doesn't have any meat.Please consider changing the crew meals ratio and the options From safety aspect having the same meal for the crew and in case that meal is not good it could cause in all crew being sick.

Refreshments boxes, Ginger ales and fresh full fat milk shortage  Brand new mixed mineral containers did not have ginger ale inside; Several customers requests could not be met and they were offered alternative drink; Retirements boxes were finished 9 hours into the flight; As service sequence was changed due to chillers malfunction, several customers asked for extra snaks, pizza, sandwiches or chocolates; Several customers asked for fresh milk for their children; No customer complaints recorded;

Both the omelette and Crocque Monsieur dishes stuck to the foil dishes they were loaded in, detracting from the appearance when plated.Inconsistent appearance of food:1. Some of the waffles had the mascarpone loaded in a separate, removable foil, while others had it placed directly onto the waffle, meaning it was heated with the waffle.2. Some of the scrambled egg casseroles were very runny, while others appeared over cooked, despite being heated at the same time, for the same duration of time.

BARS LOADED WERE "STANDARD BARS" BUT SERVICE WAS WITH "DRINK DRAWER ON TOP OF THE CART"As this flight is a "CAT 3 flight under 3 hours", the service sequence require us to put a drink drawer on top of the meal cart. There are no bars following the meal.Normally, on a "CAT 2 flight", bars are loaded with drawers that are already prepared with a selection of soft drinks, white wines, red wines and beers. Crew only have to add water, juices and cups. But on today's flight, bars were standard bars.

BARS LOADED WERE "STANDARD BARS" BUT SERVICE WAS WITH "DRINK DRAWER ON TOP OF THE CART"As this flight is a "CAT 3 flight under 3 hours", the service sequence require us to put a drink drawer on top of the meal cart. There are no bars following the meal.Normally, on a "CAT 2 flight", bars are loaded with drawers that are already prepared with a selection of soft drinks, white wines, red wines and beers. Crew only have to add water, juices and cups. But on today's flight, bars were standard bars.

Fruit and cheese from the dessert service were loaded in meal casseroles  The fruits and cheese loaded in casseroles made it difficult for crew to place both options on the meal tray for the light option. Also fruits and cheese were loaded in 1 half cart and the other 2 dessert options were loaded in the other half cart instead of the selection being divided for the crew between 2 carts. 6 trays were missing the balsamic olive oil salad dressing mixture and had only plain balsamic on the tray.

Quality of GFMLCustomer provided feedback about the quality of GFML during our interaction.He and his companion, Ms.Sinclair seated at 16F, commented that they used to order GFML but have stopped as the GFML they had previously were tasteless and bland.They specifically mentioned that they had poached slices of chicken for starter and poached chicken breast for main course on their previous experiences.They have since stopped their GFML requests and prefer to pick things from the menu instead.

Pls kindly note that the Braised Beef with horseradish was by far the most popular hot meal choice on the flight.2.On the other hand the Chicken with creamy mushroom sauce was highly unpopular.3.The ration catered for the flight was 70% Beef vs 30% chicken however the actual demand indicated more like 80% Beef and very few customers opted for chicken option.4.Few customers commented that they do not mind another choice when we run out of beef,however not the chicken with creamy mushroom sauce.

1 tin of caviar missing As per the paperwork there should have been 12 tins in the container for GLA DXB flight.There were only 11 tins.Previous paperwork stated that there should have been 12 tins on our flight.There was also no white seal left for us to seal the container with as both white seals seem to have been used on the previous sector.No note or hand over form was left tor written about this.There were no white seals left so we sealed it with a green seal into Dubai seal A010489728.

Not enough sandwiches and cookies pax load was 368.We had 4 carts In Y class. 2 carts in the front with 2 drawers of sandiwches and biscuits each. 2 carts in the back. one with spmls and the other with one drawer of sandwiches and one drawer of biscuits.It was decided to give cookies to those customers who request hot drinks and sandwich to the rest. Crew meals re not enoughCrew meals were not enough for the crew.Crew meals loaded were 4 hot meals, sandwiches, fruits and yogurts for 8 crew.crew are eligible for lunch and dinner as flight departure is 13:35 (crew left their houses at 11) and landed 22:20 (crew arrived to HQ at 23:00)All crew required 2 hot meals each (one each sector), as sandwiches or fruits cannot substitute lunch or dinner, as well crew require energy for 2 full load sectors.

Stowage of MealsOnce boarded the First Class team noticed all casserole's loaded in the oven.I asked the caterer why were meals loaded and not kept chilled as the flight was a "dine on demand" service.Caterer informed me that "this is standard...".I explained that yes it might be standard however we cannot have customers consuming food that has not been chilled throughout the flight.Caterer explained that they have no choice as there was no space.

Catering Selection  Catering for 3 customers in First Class. On the sector BEY  DXB , it was noticed that in Business Class there was  shortage of small bottles of water. In First Class we also ran out of brown rolls and the Fish selection.

Meals loaded in oven without dry ice.Meals for the BF service were loaded in the oven without dry ice. HB comes as the second service before landing, meaning the hot meals will be inside the ovens from the time catering will load it onground until the service commence.An approximate of 6 hours will pass in between.A possible food spoiling may happen inbetween this duration.

VGML A tray for the VGML was provided for breakfast but no casserole.  The tray also had a yoghurt on it, same as all the other trays, which is NOT suitable for VGML as it contains milk.  There were no breads provided for VGML for the breakfast service. (no suitable pastries as they contain butter or eggs) Lunch and Light Bites service VGML was fully & properly catered for.

Mr singhania did not like that his Hindu meal for the breakfast was vegetarian as he claims that he requested a non vegetarian Hindu meal.I explained that on the breakfast service on the indian sectors the vegetarian choice is part of the menu and the other choice the non vegetarian was only egg with no kind of meat.Unfortunately we were short of the non vegetarian choice.

Feedback on meals.While doing meal appreciation I overserved that customer's did not enjoy their meals. They did not finish their meals.Upon asking almost all the customers if they were not enjoying their meals they stated that they are full. About 20% customers must have finished their casseroles rest others had half eaten casseroles.No complaints received for appetisers.

FC catering provided was 4 Hot meals for 4 customers, one meal per choice.All customers wanted the Beef Ash Gooreh, However only one could be provided, and in JC customers had already been served and no Beef was available.Customers were upset as some of them knew each other and started to comment how it was possible that only one customer was entitled to eat a meal choice.

Incorrect catering  There was not enough bread for all the trays, we could not give the same bread to al the customers. There was not enough deserts, we had only 4 deserts and had to use the deserts from the previous sector. We were short of 2 beef meal choices compared to what the catering load said. The soup tasted old. The soup jugs were still stained with tomato soup.

AVML meals provided were not appealing and lacked the taste and spiciness of an AVML, the food was bland.The starter consisted in plain dry lentils, two slices of panfried tofu lettuce and tomato.all flavourless.main course was rice, gravy mushrooms, split lentils, and steamed veggies, all flovourlesws, all 4 customers did not want to eat it.no AVML desserts were provided

He also stated that the food quality has gone significantly down. He believes that this is quite disappointing and says that he has written to the company himself without getting an answer.

Both First Class Customers Requested Extra Salad  Both customers enjoyed the salad from first class and they both requested extra. Unfortunately the extra salad was unavailable for the customers. Attempted to get a salad from other classes business and economy (Unavailable).  Customers were apologised to and both understood. Suggestion to cater at least one extra salad

Please be advised:We were only catered for 02. Salad Leaves  We only had one bag of salad leaves loaded for the flight for 07 customers. Mid flight we ran out of salad leaves. The salad in FC became very popular now that we have a protein added to the salad. Can we please look into increasing the salad leaves or maybe a bigger bag. Some customers in FC was not happy that we could not offer them salad as we ran out.

Meals partially heated on ground due to departure delay  Service CAT 2 states that meals should fully be heated on ground. Ovens were switched on  at the end of the boarding , however there was a technical delay with the aircraft. As soon as delay was announced , ovens were switched off . Y class heated meals for 14 min , J class for 7. Delay was 2 hours and 5 minutes.

Shortage Of 6 Trays And 6 Meals.I informed the ground staff in KRT that we short of meals and trays as the catering is from DXB.Ground staff in KRT informed me that they already informed the 5 customer travelling under sub load tickets that they will not be able to have their meals on board and the ground staff informed me that the customer are aware about this matter.

Meal choice.Customers seated at the aft of EY on both sides of the cabin ,specially from approximately rows 43 downwards did not receive any chicken options ,The percentage loaded for the meals was 8 chickens for meal cart . The rest was all vegetarian meals .most customers were upset and some even refused to eat and complained as to why they didn't get chicken meals .

CONDIMENTSThe condiments were catered in soup bowls inside bulk cart and although they were meant to be covered by a plastic lid, all the bowls were uncovered and condiments overflowing. This way of loading the condiments does not seem suitable, as the bowls are not secure inside the cart and they keep sliding every time a tray is moved making the lids fall off easily.

QULITY OF DINNER AND BREAKFAST MEALS  Whilst serving the dinner service feedback was obtained from the customers  Customers stated that the salmon was dry and had no taste  For the beef choice customers stated that the beef smelt old whilst also tasting stale  Customers who selected to have the yogurt and muesli stated that the muesli was stale both in taste and smell

Customer did not like the oyster sauce Customer had initially ordered the Stir Fried Beef in oyster sauce served with egg fried rice , garlic glazed pak choi.  Customer chose the Chicken Picante as he alternative meal choice.  No further or any other complaints received from customer during the flight and she said that otherwise her inflight experience has been great.

The Y/C catering was less by 10 customers. the catering load was 187 while customers checked in were 197 customers.Emirates ground staff in MLE knew about the shortage and kept on accepting more customers however he briefed them that there will not be food served to them.The customers agree as per EK Staff in MLE but after boarding and take off , they all complained.

Food in J/C being wasted during this sector  Most f the J/C customers have dinner at the Emirates lounge before the flight, therefore they refuse to have dinner on board, as they prefer to sleep, as it is a night flight; This results in a lot of waste of food, mainly appetisers, hot meals and desserts.
